info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 26 at 1:45PM MST until September 26 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Western Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 345 PM MST.
* At 145 PM MST, Strong thunderstorms across Pinal county have produced gusty winds that have resulted an area of blowing dust, especially near Picacho.
HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Pinal Airpark, Red Rock, Cactus Forest, Cockleburr, North Komelik, Kohatk, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu.
This includes the following highways... Route 79 between mile markers 102 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
